projectPurpose: Serves as the online repository and resource hub for the KAIST CS431 Concurrent Programming course, providing educational materials and assignments for students to learn and practice concurrent programming in Rust.
mainFeatures: Provides course materials for Concurrent Programming
Focuses on the Rust programming language
Covers theoretical programming models for concurrency
Explores practical implementation of locks and lock-free data structures

alternatives.name: The Rust Book (Concurrency Chapter)
mainFeatures: Covers shared state concurrency and Rust's safety guarantees
Part of the official Rust documentation

alternatives.name: Rust Atomics and Locks by Mara Bos
mainFeatures: In-depth coverage of low-level concurrency in Rust
Details implementation of locks and synchronization primitives

alternatives.name: Operating Systems: Three Easy Pieces (Concurrency sections)
mainFeatures: Classic textbook material on OS concepts
Covers foundational concurrency, threads, and locks

alternatives.name: Online Course Platforms (e.g., Coursera, edX)
mainFeatures: Cover various languages and concurrency paradigms

alternatives.name: Concurrency in C++ by Anthony Williams

marketPositioning: KAIST CS431 is positioned as a high-quality academic course repository for learning concurrent programming specifically through the lens of the Rust language. Unlike general books or online tutorials, it offers a structured, university-level curriculum with detailed assignments and theoretical depth, making it a valuable resource for students formally studying the subject or advanced self-learners seeking a rigorous approach to concurrency in Rust.
